newsitem.title: JAPAN: Britain's Clarke upbeat about Japan deregulation.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Clarke upbeat about Japan deregulation.

text.p: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke said on Wednesday he was upbeat about Japan's financial deregulation plans.
"I welcome the Japanese announcement that they're going to deregulate their financial markets," he told Reuters.
"I think it will be a great benefit to Japan and I think it offers considerable opportunities to the British financial services industry as well," he said.

Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto in November unveiled a five-year Big Bang plan to liberalise Japan's financial markets and try to catch up with reforms carried out more than a decade ago in Europe and North America.
Clarke arrived in Japan on Wednesday afternoon from Mexico City to meet senior Japanese government officials including his counterpart, Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka.
Clarke declined to comment on British monetary policy or the single European currency debate.
